title: Kiffin denies ultimatum by Ole Miss: 'Not true'

title: Biryani sellers-turned-bike lifters arrested in Bengaluru
content: The Mahadevapura police have arrested two persons who worked as biryani vendors during the day and allegedly turned into serial offenders at night, stealing high-end motorcycles parked outside houses

title: Techie murdered for asking back loan, body buried inside house in Andhra Pradesh
content: A 30-year-old software engineer who went missing from Attibele was found murdered and buried inside the house of his cousin in Andhra Pradesh

title: Residents of mental health care facilities can vote unless declared as disqualified: HC
content: Individuals with mental health issues and those with intellectual disabilities too are citizens of the country, says court; dismisses plea that such persons are incompetent to cast their votes as per their free will

title: Congress‚Äô bid to field BJP leader in Cheralayi division falls flat
content: Shyamala S. Prabhu declines to contest as an Independent backed by the UDF in Cheralayi; says she remains loyal to the BJP; Congress announces Meenu Rajan, an ASHA worker, as its candidate in the division

title: Anbumani opposes proposed SIPCOT complex in Cuddalore
content: He says the district is already facing environmental degradation due to industrial pollution from the coal mines in the area

content: The conclave will be the 3rd¬†regional investment summit in¬†T.N. after¬†Thoothukudi¬†and¬†Hosur, deliberately shifting the spotlight away from Chennai and reinforcing our commitment to distributed growth, says Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa

title: Indonesian Minister‚Äôs Delhi visit to advance BrahMos defence partnership
content: The Indonesia deal will be a major milestone for India‚Äôs defence exports, showcasing the country‚Äôs capability to supply advanced, combat-proven indigenous weapons, officials said

title: 130 Sri Lankan refugees in Tamil Nadu rehabilitation camps eligible to apply for Indian passports: official survey
content: The survey was undertaken a few months ago by the State¬† Commissionerate¬†of Rehabilitation and Welfare of Non-Resident Tamils among the residents of the camp. It covered only sections of the camp residents and its findings should not be considered exhaustive

title: Karnataka police launch ‚ÄòSanmitra‚Äô initiative to combat drug abuse
content: In a major step towards curbing the growing menace of drug addiction among the youth, the Karnataka State Police Department has rolled out ‚ÄòSanmitra‚Äô ( a good friend ), an initiative aimed at providing sustained support, rehabilitation, and monitoring for individuals struggling with substance abuse

title: A village with a temple and real estate boom on¬†East Coast Road
content: A lot of devotees visit the¬†Nithyakalyanaperumal¬†Temple at¬†Thiruvidanthai¬†daily.¬†But they are inconvenienced by lack of amenities. Chennai residents buy up land here, attracted by clean air

title: Two arrested for teenager‚Äôs murder
content: A search has been launched for at least four others, including the person who allegedly stabbed the deceased using a sharp iron rod

title: Russia to soon approve nearly 25 Indian fishery units for exports
content: Recently, the European Union (EU) has approved 102 additional marine product units from India for exports

title: India, Russia intensify consultations ahead of Putin‚Äôs Delhi visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi meets head of Russia‚Äôs Maritime Board, External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar meets with President Putin in Moscow

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat to visit strife-torn Manipur
content: Visit comes amid talks for popular government formation; RSS chief had earlier called for peace in the State

title: ‚ÄòIndia needs to catch up with China‚Äôs breakneck speed in innovation‚Äô
content: Experts expressed the view that product-led growth should be the focus rather than one that relies on being the ‚Äòback office of the world‚Äô with millions of engineers who write codes

title: Conclave on migration ends; stressed need to address social aspects of migration
content: International Institute of Migration and Development chair S. Irudaya Rajan says there has been a rise in suicide cases of Indians in countries like Canada, where at least one migrant attempts suicide every week

title: KEONICS receives pre-orders for 1,500 units of its new AI-computer
content: KEO is Karnataka‚Äôs practical answer to the digital divide, says Priyank Kharge about the computer priced at ‚Çπ18,999

title: 2020 Delhi riot was not spontaneous but pre-planned, Solicitor General tells Supreme Court
content: Tushar Mehta says the Delhi riot was nothing less than an ‚Äúattack on the sovereignty of the nation‚Äù and the version of spontaneity being peddled is a ‚Äúmyth‚Äù

title: Kerala B.Tech students develop ‚ÄòEVM Track‚Äô software for State Election Commission
content: Aashin C. Anil and Jeswin Sunsi were felicitated by State Election Commissioner A. Shajahan for their contribution to the electoral process

title: Separate Section created in DPDP Rules for persons with disabilities
content: In the draft rule regarding consent mechanism, persons with disabilities had been clubbed with children; activists hail separation of Sections in the notified rules, but raise concern over lack of clarity on laws of guardianship

title: Think Bengaluru traffic is bad? Try controlling it
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru‚Äôs busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: Coffee Board of India sets a target to double production to over 7 lakh tonnes by 2047
content: Goal is to achieve 15% speciality coffee out of this 7 lakh tons, says Coffee Board Chairman M.J. Dinesh

title: Over 100 minors, held as bonded labourers, rescued from Raipur factory
content: NHRC member says that the children ‚Äì mostly tribals from Assam, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Odisha ‚Äì were exposed to formaldehyde, a chemical known to cause cancer

title: NEP in Maharashtra: Panchet‚Äôs model cluster school highlights gains‚Äîand gaps
content: Maharashtra‚Äôs school mergers seek to enhance resources and accessibility, but face criticism over their impact on education equity.

title: Jaishankar calls on Russian President Putin
content: ‚ÄúApprised him (Mr. Putin) of preparations underway for the upcoming Annual India Russia Summit. Also discussed regional and global developments. Deeply value his perspectives and guidance on further advancement of our ties,‚Äù Mr. Jaishankar said

title: On Bangladesh‚Äôs extradition request for Hasina, Delhi has several options
content: No formal extradition request received yet; treaty permits exceptions for ‚Äúpolitical offences‚Äù, ‚Äúunjust or oppressive charges‚Äù; Delhi could allow Ms. Hasina her say during an extradition trial or deny ICT‚Äôs validity

title: Raj Bhavan files police complaint against Trinamool MP for arms distributed from Governor House remark
content: The complaint by Raj Bhawan commission of offence under Section 151 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Samhita (BNS) which is non bailable in nature. Governor Bose had indicated that he will take strongest possible action against the  Trinamool MP for the remark that arms were distributed from Raj Bhawan.

title: 24 government hospitals in Andhra Pradesh to have Critical Care Blocks
content: 22 hospitals will have 50 beds, one will have 75 and another will have 100 beds; In every 50-bed CCB, there will be a ten-bed ICU, a six-bed mini ICU, maternity, isolation and casualty wards and beds for dialysis patients

title: ‚ÄòMissing candidates‚Äô vexes opposing electoral campaigns
content: Political parties discovering their candidates missing from the voters‚Äô list at the last minute is threatening to upend campaigns in at least two corporations and one municipality.

title: Tharoor praises Modi‚Äôs speech on India‚Äôs ‚Äòconstructive‚Äô impatience for development
content: The Congress MP says the Prime Minister‚Äôs appeal for a decade-long mission to restore pride in India‚Äôs heritage, languages, and knowledge traditions was a central theme of the speech

title: Anmol Bishnoi, key accused in Baba Siddique murder case, being deported from U.S., police say
content: Mumbai Police had sent two proposals about his extradition, the official said, adding there are multiple cases registered against the gangster across the country, and the Union government will decide to which agency his custody should be given first.

title: Opposition takes a dig at AAP over poor law and order in Punjab
content: Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the AAP government had completely abdicated its authority and the criminals and gangsters were killing people with impunity

title: Greater Tirupati to expand from Kalyani dam to IIT campus
content: MCT council approves plans to enlarge city limits, bringing key reservoirs and 10 consenting panchayats into the corporation‚Äôs jurisdiction

title: Delhi blast: Government cautions TV channels against airing videos of accused persons justifying violent acts
content: Such broadcasts may inadvertently encourage or incite violence, disrupt public order, and pose risks to national security, it says

title: Devotion, enthusiasm mark ‚ÄòSri Sathya Sai Rathotsavam‚Äô in Puttaparthi
content: Former Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu and a host of dignitaries take part in the first-ever chariot festival; Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan to attend the celebrations on November 19

title: Reconstruction of 498 ancient temples under way with ‚Çπ603 crore: Endowments Minister
content: A committee has been formed to ensure government cooperation with private temples so that no difficulties arise during major festivals, says Anam

title: Pilot project begins as GBA prepares citywide paid parking plan backed by DULT study
content: As Bengaluru‚Äôs streets choke under unregulated parking, the Greater Bengaluru Authority has drawn up a plan to introduce paid parking across¬†all five corporation wards

title: LDF finalises plan for district panchayat in Pathanamthitta
content: Of the 17 seats, CPI(M) will contest in 10, CPI in three, Kerala Congress (M) in two seats while RJD and JD(S) will contest in one seat each

title: PM-KISAN funds row in West Bengal: BJP claims ‚Çπ10,500 crore disbursed; TMC cries foul
content: State BJP President Samik Bhattacharya alleges TMC reluctance delayed benefits for 46 lakh farmers; TMC counters, calling the claims ‚Äúpreposterous and baseless‚Äù

title: Telangana gearing to unveil ‚Çπ1,000-crore Fund of Funds for startups
content: Rollout likely in January, focus to be on AI startups; State also keen on emerging as global AI hub, says IT Secretary Sanjay Kumar

title: CPI demands judicial probe into encounter in Alluri Sitharama Raju district
content: It is unacceptable for a democratically elected government to resort to encounters instead of resolving issues through negotiations, says CPI leader Ramakrishna

title: TTD board firm on unravelling the conspiracy behind the Parakamani scam
content: At a high-level meeting, it has decided to take immediate steps to nullify the ‚Äòcollusive Lok Adalat award‚Äô dated September 9, 2023, and file a fresh complaint to unravel more such thefts and misappropriations that may have happened in the past

title: City of Pearls reclaims its crown as Hyderabad Pearls move one step closer to GI tag
content: Hyderabad‚Äôs reputation as the ‚ÄúCity of Pearls‚Äù is rooted in its history under the Qutb Shahi dynasty and the Nizams, who imported natural pearls from the Arabian Gulf, particularly Basra, and developed a thriving pearl-processing industry

title: Rare failure for Vaibhav Suryavanshi, but Harsh Dubey steers India 'A' into semis
content: India 'A' secured a spot in the ACC Men‚Äôs Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 semifinals with a six-wicket win over Oman. Chasing 136, Harsh Dubey's unbeaten 53 guided them home after a shaky start. Earlier, Oman were restricted to 135/7 despite Hammad Mirza's quickfire 32 and Wasim Ali's 54.

title: Nowgam blast: Hospital guard, cook led first rescue; raced into fireball
content: A powerful explosion rocked Nowgam police station in Srinagar, prompting an immediate response from a hospital guard and cook who rushed wounded officers to Ujala Cygnus Hospital. The medical team treated 23 casualties, showcasing their preparedness for mass-casualty events. The hospital manager highlighted the bravery of the initial responders.

title: Cloudflare outage resolved: What the error message meant; major AI platforms affected
content: Major online services like ChatGPT and Claude faced widespread disruption due to a Cloudflare technical glitch. Users encountered a 'Please unblock challenges.cloudflare.com to proceed' error, indicating a malfunction in Cloudflare's security verification system. The outage, which began around 6:00 AM ET, impacted numerous websites relying on Cloudflare's network for security and performance.

title: 'How explosives reached police station?' Omar seeks answers after blast; LG rules out terror angle
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah expressed hope for answers regarding a late-night blast at Srinagar's Nowgam police station that killed nine and injured 30. While police initially described the explosion as accidental, Abdullah pressed for clarity on the explosives' origin and handling. LG Manoj Sinha previously ruled out a terrorist plot, praising police for dismantling a pan-India module.

title: PMGKAY cleanup: Govt excludes 2 cr ineligible beneficiaries; introduces AI feedback system
content: The government has removed over two crore ineligible beneficiaries from the PMGKAY free foodgrain scheme in recent months, while simultaneously adding new eligible individuals. To enhance transparency and accountability, an AI-powered platform, Asha, has been launched for beneficiaries to provide feedback on ration distribution in their preferred language.

title: Google Gemini 3.0 launched: CEO Pichai calls it ‚Äòbest model for multimodal understanding‚Äô
content: Google has unveiled Gemini 3.0, its most advanced AI model, boasting state-of-the-art reasoning and unprecedented multimodal understanding. CEO Sundar Pichai declared it the world's best for multimodal comprehension, capable of bringing ideas to life with superior coding and agentic abilities. The model excels at complex problem-solving and requires less prompting, demonstrating remarkable performance across industry benchmarks.

title: Climate Change Performance Index: India slips 13 ranks; figures at 23rd position
content: India has fallen 13 ranks to 23rd in the Climate Change Performance Index, marking its biggest decline. Despite strong renewable energy growth, a rising trend in GHG emissions and a lack of a coal phase-out plan contributed to the drop. Experts suggest reducing new coal plants and continuing renewable expansion for a better future ranking.

title: One shot too many: Sooryavanshi's hot streak breaks with a rare low score
content: Young prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi experienced a rare setback, scoring just 12 against Oman in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. This follows his explosive 144 against UAE and a solid 45 against Pakistan.  The 14-year-old, who also holds an IPL record for a rapid century, was dismissed attempting a big hit.  His brief innings included two boundaries.

title: Trump rolls out red carpet for MBS as US takes to green flags
content: Donald Trump welcomed Saudi Prince Mohammed bin Salman with a red carpet and military honors, signaling a strategic reset in U.S. regional relations. The visit secured billions in business deals, including arms sales and nuclear cooperation, despite ongoing criticism over the Khashoggi murder. This recalibration also impacts U.S. ties with Pakistan and India.

title: Cloudflare outage explained: What is 'latent bug' that took the internet down
content: A latent bug in Cloudflare's bot mitigation system triggered a widespread outage, impacting hundreds of websites globally for nearly six hours. The configuration file error caused a "spike in unusual traffic," leading to "massive digital gridlock" for users. Major platforms like ChatGPT and Twitter were among those affected.

title: Busting myths: H-1B workers are not 'cheap labour'; why they are important for US
content: A National Foundation for American Policy report argues that H-1B visa restrictions, including a new $100,000 fee, are counterproductive. The report highlights that H-1B holders are highly skilled professionals earning substantial salaries, not cheap labor, and that limiting these visas could drive jobs and innovation abroad.

title: X, ChatGPT down: Big glitch hits Cloudflare; 100s of websites affected - check list
content: A widespread internet disruption is affecting popular platforms like X and ChatGPT due to issues with Cloudflare, a major content delivery network provider. Users are encountering error messages and are unable to access various websites and online services. The problems began this morning and are directly linked to Cloudflare's system malfunctions.

title: NFL stuns fans by refusing to flex Commanders-Broncos SNF after Daniels injury
content: The NFL will not change its Sunday Night Football game featuring the Washington Commanders and Denver Broncos. This decision comes despite the Commanders' losing streak and their starting quarterback's injury. Broadcast protection rules and network priorities prevented a schedule change. Fans expected a more competitive matchup, but league decisions remained unchanged.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals coach assesses recovery amid slump
content: Arizona Cardinals running back Trey Benson, who replaced an injured James Conner, is sidelined with a brutal knee injury sustained in Week 5. Despite initial hopes for a Week 10 return, his recovery timeline remains unclear. Head coach Jonathan Gannon stated Benson is progressing but not yet ready to play, marking his sixth missed game.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Guwahati Test - Proteas add Lungi Ngidi as cover for Kagiso Rabada
content: South Africa bolsters their pace attack for the second Test against India with the inclusion of Lungi Ngidi, replacing the injured Kagiso Rabada. Ngidi's return comes after a strong performance in the first Test where South Africa secured a historic victory. India now faces the challenge of leveling the series in Guwahati.

title: Fire breaks out at Bigg Boss 16 fame Shiv Thakare's home, actor is safe
content: In a shocking turn of events, a fire erupted in the Mumbai residence of Shiv Thakare, the Bigg Boss 16 contestant, creating considerable havoc in Goregaon. Fortunately, the reality television icon had just returned to his home and is reported safe. Disturbing visuals shared online showcase the severity of the incident.

title: 'Attack on RJD‚Äôs soul': Tej Pratap flags ‚Äòpressure‚Äô on Lalu, Rabri; makes plea to PM Modi, Shah
content: Tej Pratap Yadav has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to investigate alleged mental and physical pressure on his parents, Lalu Prasad and Rabri Devi. He called it an attack on the RJD's soul, naming individuals he claims harassed his sister Rohini Acharya.

title: 'Complicated': Trump official on India-US trade deal; what's holding up pact?
content: India-US trade deal: A senior Trump administration official indicated a trade deal between India and the US is nearing finalization, though complexities arise from India's dealings with Russia. Discussions have been ongoing since March, with both sides expressing optimism for a fair and balanced agreement that protects Indian communities.

title: Was Stephen A. Smith fired? Shock twist may reshape ESPN‚Äôs NBA Countdown
content: Stephen A. Smith is out of ESPN's NBA Countdown. He will not be on the show for the remainder of the season. This marks his first absence in over two decades. A new team will cover NBA games. This includes Mark Malone and Kendrick Perkins. Malika Andrews hosts. The show will use new virtual reality technology. Stephen A.

title: US jobs & AI: Trump adviser blames AI-led efficiency for labour market 'quiet time'
content: A senior Trump administration economic adviser suggested AI could boost worker productivity, potentially reducing the need for new hires. While acknowledging mixed job market signals, he highlighted strong output growth, attributing it to AI-driven efficiency. However, he predicted this cooling effect on hiring would be temporary as market forces adjust.

title: Explained: Why Warren Buffett‚Äôs Berkshire is betting on Google-parent Alphabet?
content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has made a significant multibillion-dollar investment in Alphabet, Google's parent company, marking a rare move into fast-growing tech. This substantial stake, now among Berkshire's top ten holdings, highlights Alphabet's strong cash flows, dominant market position, and appealing valuation, even as Berkshire trims other investments and holds record cash.

title: 'Sinister design': Congress attacks EC over SIR; to hold rally in December
content: In a recent AICC meet, Rahul Gandhi has expressed deep apprehension regarding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, fearing it may unjustly disenfranchise genuine voters. He called upon Congress to tackle this issue from political, organizational, and legal fronts.

title: Sophie Cunningham disses Caitlin Clark: Never trust her with my social media
content: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham humorously declared teammate Caitlin Clark would be her last choice to manage her social media, calling her a "shit starter." This lighthearted jab highlights their strong off-court bond as both players recover from season-ending injuries. Cunningham has consistently defended Clark's significant impact on the WNBA's popularity.

title: UK MPs in China's crosshairs: MI5 issues spy alert; how they are being targetted
content: British intelligence agency MI5 has issued an "espionage alert" to UK MPs and peers, warning that China is attempting to recruit parliamentarians. Individuals linked to China's ministry of state security are reportedly using professional networking sites and recruitment agents to establish long-term relationships and gather information.

title: Meet Thomas Massie: The Republican who is openly defying Trump
content: He is not Liz Cheney, who converted resistance to Trump into a full-time vocation. He is not Mitt Romney, who gave a valedictory speech and left Washington shaking his head. Massie is something more awkward and therefore more interesting: a Republican who will accept Trump‚Äôs endorsement and still publicly defy him; a man who will pose for a Christmas card with his family holding assault rifles and then, in the next breath, launch a bureaucratic insurgency to force the president into a corner on one of the darkest scandals of the age.

title: Delhi blast: Cong MP's 'misguided' remark sparks fury; BJP calls him 'spin doctor'
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticized Congress MP Imran Masood for calling suicide bomber Umar Un Nabi a "misguided youth." Poonawalla accused the Congress of prioritizing vote bank politics over national interest, citing past instances where opposition leaders allegedly downplayed terror acts. The remarks came after a video emerged of the bomber justifying his actions.

title: Death penalty for Hasina: Dhaka wants her back; can India refuse extradition?
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to death in absentia for the 2024 student crackdown, a verdict she called a foregone conclusion. India responded cautiously, acknowledging the verdict and reiterating its commitment to Bangladesh's peace and stability, while remaining non-committal on extradition requests.

title: Babar Azam slapped with heavy fine; ICC punish batter for code of conduct breach
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam faced a penalty from the ICC, receiving a 10% match fee fine for a Code of Conduct breach.  The incident involved him striking the stumps with his bat after being dismissed in the third ODI against Sri Lanka. This marks his first offense in two years, resulting in a demerit point.

title: Laid-off employee in her 40s shares 5 ways mid-career professionals can bounce back
content: Mid-career professionals in their 40s are facing increasing layoffs, impacting their identity and confidence. Laura Zimmermaker's experience highlights the importance of reclaiming professional identity, rebuilding narratives with intention, and learning to articulate one's story with confidence. Treating rejection as information and building alternative paths can lead to reinvention and autonomy.

title: 'No whitewashing!' India roars at SCO; demands 'zero tolerance' on terror
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar urged the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) to adopt a "zero tolerance" approach to terrorism, emphasizing its founding purpose. Speaking in Moscow, he also called for reforms in the organization's working methods to adapt to the evolving global landscape. Jaishankar highlighted India's right to defend its people against terrorism.

title: Delhi 2020 riots 'attack on sovereignty': Cops oppose Umar Khalid's bail in SC
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2020 Delhi riots were a pre-planned attempt to divide society communally, not a spontaneous protest. He argued accused activists are responsible for trial delays. Meanwhile, the Delhi high court directed police to update on riot investigations, noting petitions have been pending for six years without pursuing alternate legal remedies.

title: Pitch in focus - After Eden Gardens' criticism, Guwahati may offer turn and bounce at pace
content: Guwahati's Barsapara Stadium is gearing up for an exciting Test match, with its red soil pitch poised to provide superb bounce and carry. The Indian team management is advocating for spin-friendly conditions against South Africa, and the expertise of BCCI head curator Ashish Bhowmick promises a pitch that delivers.

title: 5 common medicines that can damage kidneys and what are the alternatives
content: Millions in India face chronic kidney disease, with drug-induced damage a significant concern. Common medications like NSAIDs, antibiotics, and contrast agents can harm kidneys, especially with long-term use or in vulnerable individuals. Understanding these risks and consulting doctors is crucial for prevention.

title: Ashes down under: First since 1982 - Why Gabba will not host first Test of series?
content: The Ashes series opener moves from Brisbane's Gabba for the first time since 1982, with Perth Stadium hosting the first Test. This shift, driven by commercial decisions and scheduling, marks a departure from the Gabba's historical dominance, especially against England. The series will then proceed to Brisbane for a day-night Test.

title: What US numbers and India‚Äôs rise tell us about American dream
content: Open Doors 2025 shows a sharp shift in US international education. Total international students hit 1.17 million, but new arrivals are down and enrolled classroom numbers are flat. Growth is now driven by OPT and post-study work, not fresh enrolment. India leads this transition as the top sender, powering STEM, OPT and the new version of the American dream.

title: 'Shouted at stupid people': Trump says trade talks with 'a country' left his voice hoarse
content: President Trump explained his hoarse voice stemmed from arguing with individuals he deemed "stupid" about trade and tariff policies. He admitted to "blowing his stack" during discussions with an unnamed country attempting to renegotiate a trade deal, a move that has become a central point of his economic agenda amidst a Supreme Court review of his emergency powers.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Cheap, Deadly: The Hamas-Style Weapons Terrorists Wanted To Hit Delhi With
content: The white collar terror module behind the Red Fort suicide car bomb attack on November 10, was preparing Hamas-style improvised rockets and weaponised drones.

title: Google Launches Gemini 3, Embeds AI Model Into Search Immediately
content: Alphabet's Google on Tuesday launched the latest version of its artificial intelligence model Gemini, emphasising that the new capabilities will be immediately available in several profit-generating products like its search engine.

title: Doctor Arrested For Ricin Terror Plot Injured After Fight In Gujarat Jail
content: Ricin terror plot suspect Ahmed Mohiyuddin Saiyed, arrested recently by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS), was injured in a fight with three undertrial inmates inside the high-security Sabarmati Central Prison in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

title: China Masterminded "Disinformation Campaign" After Op Sindoor: US Body
content: The US-China Economic and Security Review Commission, a US Congress-created advisory body, accused China on Tuesday of masterminding a disinformation campaign after Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Quiz Him, Find Real Mastermind': Baba Siddique's Son On Anmol Bishnoi Extradition
content: Just hours before Anmol Bishnoi, a key accused in the murder of his father Baba Siddique, lands in India, NCP leader and ex MLA Zeeshan Siddique said the gangster needs to be brought to Mumbai and questioned to find out who the real mastermind is.

title: Cannon Fire, Horse Parade: Inside Trump's Grand Welcome For Saudi Prince
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman received a red carpet welcome from President Donald Trump on Tuesday, on his first visit to the United States since the 2018 murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: "Things Happen": Trump Defends Saudi Crown Prince Over Khashoggi Murder
content: President Donald Trump welcomed Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to Washington on Tuesday as the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia makes his first White House visit since the 2018 killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.

title: Al Falah University Founder Arrested In Money Laundering Case
content: Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui, the founder of Al Falah University - the epicentre of terror module behind the Delhi blast, was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a terror financing-linked money laundering case on Tuesday.

title: "Looking Forward To Hosting President Putin": PM Modi Tells Top Kremlin Aide
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday told a top Kremlin aide that he is looking forward to hosting Russian President Vladimir Putin in India next month.

title: Woman, 58, Collapses And Dies In Sabarimala Temple Darshan Queue
content: A 58-year-old woman collapsed and died while waiting in queue for darshan at the Lord Ayyappa shrine in Sabarimala on Tuesday, sources in the district administration said.

title: Congress Show-Causes 43 Leaders For Anti-Party Activity During Bihar Polls
content: The Congress on Tuesday issued show-cause notices to 43 leaders, including former ministers, accusing them of anti-party activities during the Bihar assembly elections.

title: Facing A Different India: Ahmed Patel's Daughter's Wake-Up Call To Congress
content: Mumtaz Patel, daughter of Congress' Ahmed Patel, has posted a wake-up message on social media platform X, reprimanding the party over its performance in the Bihar elections. Asked about the matter, she said the party needs to change with the times.

title: BJP Demands Police Action After DMK Functionary's Alleged Death Threat Against PM Modi
content: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Nainar Nagenthran has demanded immediate police action against a DMK functionary after a video surfaced in which he allegedly issues a death threat against Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Centre Issues Media Advisory For Delhi Suicide Blast Coverage
content: The Union government, on Tuesday, issued an advisory to all private satellite television channels to exercise restraint while telecasting news relating to the Delhi Red Fort attack.

title: 'He Hates Indian Population': Trump Son's Big Allegation Against Zohran Mamdani
content: Eric Trump has intensified his criticism of New York City's incoming mayor, Zohran Mamdani, asserting that the mayor-elect "hates the Indian population."

title: Anganwadi Worker On SIR Duty Tries To Die By Suicide: Tamil Nadu Police
content: Amid the Election Commission of India's (ECI) Special Intensive Revision (SIR), an anganwadi worker in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur on Tuesday allegedly attempted suicide due to the heavy workload.

title: Karnataka Issues Advisory On 'Brain-Eating Amoeba' For Sabarimala Pilgrims
content: Noting that the infection does not spread from person to person or by drinking contaminated water, the advisory said, Naegleria fowleri is a highly virulent microorganism that, when inhaled through water, can reach the brain.

title: 'Attack On Sovereignty': Cops Oppose Bail Pleas Of Delhi Riots Case Accused
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday resumed hearing the bail pleas of student leaders Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, Gulfisha Fatima, and others, the alleged "larger conspiracy" behind the 2020 North East Delhi riots.

title: 'Smoke From Punjab Doesn't Even Reach Delhi': Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday sparked a debate on Delhi's air pollution, attributing it to the contributions of local and neighbouring states.

title: Yogi Berra's rookie jersey found at Harlem Boys & Girls Club 70 years ago sells for $363K
content: the 1947 new york Yankees jersey sold for $363,505, including buyer's premium . the jersey was photo-matched to the second game of Berra's rookie season . he wore no. 38 and no. 35 during his debut season and 35 in 1947 .

title: Week 12 Power Rankings: Oklahoma jumps into top 10; three new teams join the list
content: Texas still has a path to the College Football Playoff despite three losses . the Aggies left Kyle Field at 10-0 for the first time since 1992 . they have areas to improve as the most important games, including their first appearance since 1992, are ahead .

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: John Cena gets help from his friends in final Monday performance
content: the "World's Most Famous Arena" is a popular venue for professional wrestling . it was the home base for the world wide Wrestling Federation when it operated out of the Northeastern United States under the old regional territory system . fans got a big title change, a hefty Survivor Series: WarGames title match announcement and three massive unannounced names returning .

title: Where college football's top 20 freshmen rank after two months
content: tuesday's vs. byu Cougars looks at our expanded top 20 through week 12 . toney reclassified into the 2025 class and wasted no time proving he was undervalued as a three-star recruit . he has also shown up against the toughest opponents .

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: he will face former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua in a heavyweight fight Dec. 19 at Kaseya Center in Miami (Netflix) it's a drastic shift in gears after Paul was originally scheduled to face a catchweight of 195 pounds last week . the fight was canceled in the wake of a lawsuit filed by his ex-girlfriend that accused him of battery, aggravated battery, false imprisonment, kidnapping and intentional infliction of emotional distress .

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: the Buffalo Bills (-4.5) visit the Houston Texans as road favorites on "Thursday Night Football" the late window features a matchup of NFC East rivals when the Dallas Cowboys host the Philadelphia Eagles . the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Los Angeles Rams close out the slate on "sunday night football"

title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: UFC champion Makhachev heads welterweight uprising
content: Islam Makhachev has made a big move in the ESPN divisional rankings . he came into UFC 322 already ranked at no. 1 . the move is just part of the upheaval that brought about at welterweight .

title: Who are the favorites for Tucker? Which teams will go all-in this winter? Passan's MLB offseason preview
content: the largest free agent contract the Pirates have ever handed out was more than a decade ago . the Pittsburgh Pirates were primed to spend more than twice that on Josh Naylor before he re-upped with Seattle for five years and $92.5 million in the first signing .

title: Offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: Solak: Let's rank the best coaching hires and find the good in the Seahawks' loss
content: a marquee week for benchings is in the books . it's a mark for last-second, winning plays, if you're into that . we'll look at what the biggest storylines mean and what comes next .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close before the third ranking?
content: the college football playoff field includes 19 power 4 teams still in contention to compete for their respective conference titles . four teams (Alabama, Georgia, Texas A&M and Ole Miss) are still eligible to reach the SEC championship game . there are no locks in the Big 12, where Texas Tech, BYU, Cincinnati and Arizona State are all still alive .

title: Your Champions Classic guide: Keys to Kansas-Duke, Michigan State-Kentucky
content: the no. 12 Kentucky Wildcats are set to tip off the 2025 State Farm Champions Classic against the No. 17 Michigan State Spartans . all but one of the 12 games in the past six editions of Champions Classic have been decided by double digits .
